Question: What is React?

Answers.Name: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
A programming language
A server-side framework
A database management system

Question: What does JSX stand for?

Answers.Name: JavaScript XML
JavaScript Syntax Extension
JavaScript Syntax eXecution
JavaScript eXtensible Stylesheet

Question: What is a component in React?

Answers.Name: A reusable, self-contained piece of UI
A built-in JavaScript function
A predefined HTML element
A data storage structure

Question: What is state in React?

Answers.Name: An object that represents the data of a component
A keyword used for looping in JavaScript
A JavaScript module for importing code
A React-specific HTML attribute

Question: What is the purpose of the componentDidMount lifecycle method?

Answers.Name: To perform actions after the component is mounted
To render the component on the screen
To update the component's state
To handle user input events

Question: What is the purpose of the render method in React?

Answers.Name: To render the component's UI based on its current state
To define the component's initial state
To handle user interactions with the component
To perform cleanup tasks when the component is unmounted

Question: What is React Router used for?

Answers.Name: To handle client-side routing in a React application
To manage the state of a React component
To connect React components to a Redux store
To make HTTP requests in a React application

Question: What is the purpose of PropTypes in React?

Answers.Name: To define the expected types of component props
To validate the component's state
To create reusable UI components
To handle asynchronous operations in React

Question: What are React hooks?

Answers.Name: Functions that allow functional components to have state and lifecycle methods
Built-in React components for common UI elements
Methods for handling user events in React
Libraries used for server-side rendering in React

Question: What is the purpose of the useEffect hook in React?

Answers.Name: To perform side effects in functional components
To handle form submissions in React
To manage global state in a React application
To create reusable custom hooks in React

Question: What is a React component lifecycle?

Answers.Name: A set of methods that are invoked at different stages of a component's life
The duration of time a component remains on the screen
The maximum number of child components a component can have
A React-specific design pattern for building UI

Question: What is the purpose of the shouldComponentUpdate method?

Answers.Name: To control whether a component should re-render or not
To handle errors that occur during component rendering
To fetch data from an API before rendering the component
To set the initial state of a component

Question: What are controlled components in React?

Answers.Name: Components where the value of form elements is controlled by React state
Components that are rendered conditionally based on a boolean value
Components that handle user interactions without updating the state
Components that manage global application state in Redux

Question: What is the purpose of the React Fragment component?

Answers.Name: To group multiple elements without introducing additional nodes in the DOM
To create custom reusable components in React
To handle form submissions in React
To make AJAX requests in a React application

Question: What is React context?

Answers.Name: A way to share data between components without passing props manually at every level
A technique to encapsulate and reuse UI components
A library for styling React components
A method to define the initial state of a component

Question: What is the purpose of the React Router Link component?

Answers.Name: To create links for client-side navigation in a React application
To handle form submissions in React
To manage the state of a React component
To make HTTP requests in a React application

Question: What is the role of the Redux library in React applications?

Answers.Name: To manage global state and handle complex state management in React
To create and manage forms in React
To handle client-side routing in a React application
To handle asynchronous operations in React

Question: What is the purpose of the useMemo hook in React?

Answers.Name: To memoize the value of a function to optimize performance
To handle form submissions in React
To create reusable custom hooks in React
To perform side effects in functional components

Question: What is the purpose of the useReducer hook in React?

Answers.Name: To manage state using a reducer function and dispatch actions
To handle form submissions in React
To manage global state in a React application
To create reusable custom hooks in React

Question: What is React lazy loading?

Answers.Name: A technique to load components asynchronously when they are needed
A method to optimize rendering performance in React
A way to handle user interactions with a React component
A technique to handle server-side rendering in React
